ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Workshopping theses with fellow cog sci people.
Learnt how to design and run a full research project
How to write an empirical essay
Writing as scientific thesis was an totally different style of writing. I improved my ability to think logically and scientifically.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: in principle the goal of the course, to present everybody's work and get feedback from peers, is good; however, the two hours for this seminar every week would have been better spent actually working on the thesis; organizing a symposium with proper presentations from everyone to gather feedback instead would have been better. expectations for thesis were also not well established, some projects were very professional and rigorous, and others felt like they were cobbled together last minute, which lowered morale and made the class seem frivolous
Fantastic structure, I learnt so much from listening to my peers projects
I wonder if it might be good to have some time in the class to write the thesis in class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes really helpful to have deadlines for your thesis
I mean if you are a cog. sci major you have to take it... so...
